wikipedia_page.main: George Witherage Cotton (1821–1892) was a South Australian land dealer and Member of the South Australian Legislative Council. He was especially notable for being a champion of a scheme in South Australia to put working men onto small blocks of land (around 20 acres) on which they could carry out agricultural production.

response: George Cotton (1813–1866) was an English bishop and educator in India.
George Cotton may also refer to:
* George Cotton (courtier) (1505–1545), usher to Henry, Duke of Richmond, and brother of Sir Richard Cotton
